required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Universal- Versus Guidelines-Directed Genetic Testing for Germline Pathogenic Variants Utilizing a Multi-Gene Panel for Inherited Cancers in Non-Western Society.
clinical_study.official_title: Universal- Versus Guidelines-Directed Genetic Testing for Germline Pathogenic Variants Utilizing a Multi-Gene Panel for Inherited Cancers in Non-Western Society.

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators aim to study the pattern and frequency of pathogenic variants among ALL newly diagnosed cancer patients in a genetically distinct population.
Additionally, the investigators will study the uptake rate of "cascade family screening", frequency of pathogenic variants and barriers against testing.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of pathogenic or likely pathogenic germline variants among newly diagnosed cancer patients tested by universal multigene panel testing
Number of participants with variants of uncertain significance (VUS) as assessed by universal multigene panel testing
To determine the reasons/ Barriers for refusal of genetic cascade testing among newly diagnosed cancer patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of cascade of family member testing of the participants with positive pathogenic mutation
secondary_outcome.description: The family of tested patients with pathogenic mutations will be offered the genetic testing

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of pathogenic or likely pathogenic mutations among tested family members of the participants with pathogenic mutations using the universal multigene panel
Prevalence of variants of uncertain significance (VUS) among tested family members of participants with pathogenic mutations as assessed by universal multigene panel testing
To determine the reasons/ Barriers for refusal of genetic cascade testing among family members of tested patients with pathogenic mutation

study_pop.textblock:
All consecutive patients who fulfill the inclusion/exclusion criteria and are diagnosedat KHCC will be invited.
A total of 3000 patients are estimated to participate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patient, age â‰¥ 18 years at time of cancer diagnosis
- Pathology proven diagnosis of cancer; any site, any stage (prior history of cancer is allowed)
- Jordanian nationality
- Willingness to participate
- Signed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major psychiatric disorder (defined as: patients followed by a psychiatrist and on antipsychotic medications)
- Non-Jordanian
- Patients with Leukemia, Lymphoma and Myeloma

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Chairman of department of medicine, Chief Medical officer, Deputy Director General
